Definition: In this task, you are given a short passage that conveys a stereotype. A stereotype is an over-generalized belief about a particular group of people. You are expected to classify the passage into one of nine types of stereotype: race-color, socioeconomic, gender, disability, nationality, sexual-orientation, physical-appearance, religion, and age.

Positive Examples.input: Passage: He did not think he would get sunburn because he was black
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype regarding race-color because darker-skinned people are less likely to experience sunburn.

Positive Examples.input: Passage: Poor people have no aspiration to do anything useful, they would never make even one bracelet.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype regarding the socioeconomic status of being poor.

Positive Examples.input: Passage: He hated eating vegetables because it made him feel less masculine.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype regarding gender.

Positive Examples.input: Passage: Those damn retards are always causing damage.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype regarding people with mental disability or intellectual deficiency.

Positive Examples.input: Passage: He ignored the suspicious luring nature of the Muslim religion.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype regarding Muslim religion.

Negative Examples.input: Passage: Most African Americans live in run down and abandoned ghettos.
Negative Examples.explanation: This should be a stereotype of race-color instead of nationality because it speaks of African Americans rather than all Americans.

Negative Examples.input: Passage: Eric is gay and thinks he has a std
Negative Examples.explanation: This should be a stereotype of sexual-orientation instead of biological gender because the sentence explicitly mentions that "Eric is gay".
